metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33200 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - high
metadata.Description:
kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linux kernel through 5.12.7 enforces incorrectlimits for pointer arithmetic operations, aka CID-bb01a1bba579. This can beabused to perform out-of-bounds reads and writes in kernel memory, leadingto local privilege escalation to root. In particular, there is a cornercase where the off reg causes a masking direction change, which thenresults in an incorrect final aux->alu_limit.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33200` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-6.2.0-20-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-20-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-6.2.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1003-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
